poem:
**New Labour Psychodrama**

History's echoes ripple through time's scroll,  
Teenagers mimicking tales not their own.  
In TikTok's spotlight, Blair and Brown spar,  
Two ghosts in suits, trapped in a pixel jar.  
Their politics and passions, yesterday's glare,  
Replayed in the rhythm of modern-day flair.  
Old feuds reborn, as pixels take the stage,  
A digital dance on nostalgia's page.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I became obsessed’: New Labour psychodrama grips TikTok teenagers This summer, TikTok has been revisiting very public, deeply personal and sometimes toxic feuds from the 1990s. And it is not just the Gallagher brothers – another psychodrama has taken hold: the rivalry between Tony Blair and Gordon Brown. Videos dedicated to New Labour’s heyday are booming on the social media platform, posted by teens who were not even born then. The most viral examples splice". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
